bropals.lib.simplegame.animation

Class Track

  • java.lang.Object
    • bropals.lib.simplegame.animation.Track

  • public class Track
extends java.lang.Object
    A track of images for an Animation;

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Track(java.awt.image.BufferedImage[] imgs)
      Creates a new Track
      Track(java.awt.image.BufferedImage[] imgs, int updatesBetweenImages)
      Create a new Track object with the given images while setting how many update cycles pass before switching the image
      Track(java.awt.image.BufferedImage img, int width, int height)
      Creates a new track from splitting an image.
      Track(java.awt.image.BufferedImage img, int width, int height, int updatesBetweenImages)
      Creates a new track from splitting an image.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.awt.image.BufferedImage getCurrentImage()
      Get the current image on the track.
      void resetCounter()
      Reset the counters in the Track object.
      void setFramesBetweenImages(int framesBetweenImages)
      Set how many update cycles need to pass in GameStateRunner before it switches to the next image in the track.
      void update()
      Updates the Track object.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Track

        public Track(java.awt.image.BufferedImage[] imgs)
        Creates a new Track
        Parameters:
        imgs - The images in the track

      • Track

        public Track(java.awt.image.BufferedImage[] imgs,
     int updatesBetweenImages)
        Create a new Track object with the given images while setting how many update cycles pass before switching the image
        Parameters:
        imgs - The images in the track
        updatesBetweenImages - The amount of update cycles between an image switch.

      • Track

        public Track(java.awt.image.BufferedImage img,
     int width,
     int height)
        Creates a new track from splitting an image. The method will split the image up. It will order the animation starting from the top left and continue from left to right and top to bottom.
        Parameters:
        img - The image to be split up
        width - The width of each sub-image
        height - The height of each sub-image

      • Track

        public Track(java.awt.image.BufferedImage img,
     int width,
     int height,
     int updatesBetweenImages)
        Creates a new track from splitting an image. The method will split the image up. It will order the animation starting from the top left and continue from left to right and top to bottom. Also adds a parameter for setting the update cycles between each image switch.
        Parameters:
        img - The image to be split up
        width - The width of each sub-image
        height - The height of each sub-image
        updatesBetweenImages - The amount of update cycles between an image switch.

        Updates the Track object.

        Reset the counters in the Track object.

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage getCurrentImage()
        Get the current image on the track.
        Returns:
        The current image on the track.

      • setFramesBetweenImages

        public void setFramesBetweenImages(int framesBetweenImages)
        Set how many update cycles need to pass in GameStateRunner before it switches to the next image in the track.
        Parameters:
        framesBetweenImages - The new amount of frames.
